name: Upper External Oblique
how_to_perform:
1. **Start by lying on your back** with your arms at your sides and your legs bent, keeping your knees locked.
2. Engage your core muscles to support your spine.
3. Keeping your upper body still, lift your shoulders off the ground while simultaneously bringing your left knee towards your right shoulder.
4. Keep your left leg in contact with your right oblique muscle (diagonal) throughout the movement. Focus on generating force from this area.
5. Hold for a brief moment to emphasize the contraction, then slowly return to the starting position.
6. Repeat the exercise with your **right knee towards your left shoulder**.
short_summary: The Upper External Oblique is an effective exercise targeting the obliques and improving rotational movement.
